benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/allCustomFields - Retrieve account customFields

covered: Valid Request: Multiple success scenarios for required accountId and with combinations of audit and objectType.
Empty Response: Covered for accounts with no custom fields and for filters yielding no results.
Query Parameters: Broad coverage of valid enums (objectType, audit), combinations, unsupported params, and invalid types/values.
Error Handling: 400 for invalid accountId/objectType formats, 404 for non-existent account, 503 for service/downstream outages, 504 for network timeout.
Security/Negative: SQLi and XSS attempts handled without leakage; regression and recovery scenarios included.
Performance/Load: Large datasets, concurrent requests, and degraded performance cases considered.
Schema Validation: Several scenarios assert CustomField schema conformance.
gaps: Pagination: No tests validating pagination behavior or confirming it is intentionally absent for this endpoint.
Authorization: 403 Forbidden not validated (only 401 covered); no role/permission boundary checks.
Rate Limiting: No scenarios for throttling or 429 responses under burst traffic.
Caching Behavior: No validation of ETag/If-None-Match, Cache-Control, Last-Modified, or conditional GET semantics.
Content Negotiation/Headers: No checks for Content-Type application/json, charset, or Accept handling.
Default audit behavior: No explicit test confirming default audit=NONE when audit is omitted and ensuring absence of audit info.
ObjectType enum robustness: No test for case sensitivity (e.g., invoice vs INVOICE) or leading/trailing whitespace trimming behavior as per spec (currently assumed 400).
Error payload contract: While messages are checked, there is no assertion of standardized error schema (code, message, context).
recommendations: Add pagination-focused tests: verify presence/absence of pagination; if supported, test page size, cursors, boundaries; if not, assert headers or docs stating non-paginated to avoid ambiguity.
Expand authorization tests: include 403 Forbidden for authenticated but unauthorized principals; add role-based denial cases if applicable.
Introduce rate-limiting scenarios: simulate burst traffic to elicit 429 with Retry-After header; ensure graceful degradation.
Validate caching semantics: assert Content-Type and caching headers on 200; exercise conditional GET with ETag/If-None-Match leading to 304 Not Modified.
Add explicit default-audit test: when audit is omitted, confirm behavior equals NONE and no audit fields are present.
Strengthen header/content negotiation checks: assert application/json; test behavior for unsupported Accept values (406 if applicable).
Harden enum input tests: verify case sensitivity per spec and behavior on leading/trailing spaces (trim vs 400) to lock expected contract.
Assert standardized error schema across 400/401/403/404/503/504 responses (fields like errorType, code, message, requestId).
